page.title: 19ALNWICK DISTRICT
page.content: When you leave Alnwick to the north and west you find higher land. It is mainly moorland with typical farming for the area. The area also contains Hulne Park, which is part of the Percy Estate, which is devoted to forestry and farming. To the north and east are the Pastures, which are overlooked by the Castle, which was supposed to have been treescaped by Capability Brown. Further afield there is general mixed farming with no shortage of scattered farmsteads, the occasional hamlet and small village. This part of north Northumberland is extremely picturesque and prosperous looking. It has been described by John Wesley as, "Certainly if I didn't believe there was another world, I would spend all my summers here as I know no place in Great Britain comparable to it for pleasantness".
